results.title: Design system - Senior Product Designer
results.description:
Pennylane is building the financial OS (Operating System) for European SMEs. A single source of truth for financial data, used on one side by entrepreneurs to run their business (invoicing and getting paid, paying suppliers and expense management, piloting cash and profitability) and on the other side by their accountant for bookkeeping and fiscal declarations.

Saving time for all entrepreneurs and accountants, helping them to make the right decisions and enabling 3rd parties to offer added-value personalised financial services.

We‚Äôve launched in France and will expand to other markets in Continental Europe in 2023. Our commercial website is thus in French only but the code is obviously documented in English and our tech team speaks English.

We‚Äôre product-led, growing fast, backed by strong investors and are starting to hire software engineers anywhere in Europe, to join our experienced remote-first engineering team.


üè† Offices

The company's HQ are in Paris, but the whole Product team is remote-first. You are thus free to work from wherever you want in Europe.

üéØYour missions

In a nutshell: we are building the best financial management and accounting software for continental Europe and changing the life of entrepreneurs and accounting firms.

üë™ Team and context

The Product Design team is integrated into the product entity, alongside Product Managers. You will be an integral part of the Product Design team (currently 18 people), with whom you will collaborate on daily basis.

In order to build balanced duo for our squads, we've made sure that our Product Design ratio to a number of Product Managers is 1:1.



‚ú® What's exciting about our project?
  • The vision: We want to change the life of thousands of entrepreneurs throughout Europe with our solution
  • The ambition: We are scaling at a very rapid pace and we want to become one of the fintech leaders within 2-3 years
  • The learning curve: We have great tech mentors and experienced engineers whom you can share with and learn from everyday
  • The product: Two years after its launch, our solution has received outstanding feedback from our users, and we still have so much to build and offer!
  • The environment: We do our best to develop a culture based on trust, autonomy, and benevolence so you can feel like you're in the right place¬†


ü•á You‚Äôre the right candidate if‚Ä¶
  • You'll be leading the design system team, providing structure, making sure it has proper processes in place, making sure that it evolves to support delivery and elevate the look and feel of the product.
  • You‚Äôll own the design documentation, being one of its lead contributors, where you will work closely with other teams (Tech, Brand, Marketing, etc.) to build an exhaustive design system for the entire company.
  • You'll be on the look for the best UX/UI practices, benchmarking the global tech ecosystem, aiming towards creating the best experience for Pennylane products.
  • You'll evangelise the design system and its benefits to all Pennylane employees, maintaining frequent communication in order to keep high alignment across product and tech teams.
  • You'll lead, organise and participate in product workshops, as well as cross-functional team initiatives, so you can tackle complex and rewarding issues.
  • You are able to communicate well in both English and French.


üéÅ What we offer
  • Choice of a work laptop (Mac/Linux)
  • Remote desk set up or a use of Co-working space (we work etc.)
  • Gross Salary + Generous Stock Option Plan.
  • Alan Mind: employee access to mental health support and wellbeing.
  • Busuu: language learning platform access.
  • Gymlib: access to online workouts, or studio access if you are based in Paris.
  • Health Insurance.
  • Holidays + any bank holidays on top of standard.
  • Occasional travel to our Paris HQ for team building events/workshops/dev days (we get teams to meet every couple of months) and onboarding. As well as 2 yearly trips for company activities. Last time we went to the Alps and enjoyed two days doing fun activities in the snow, it was fabulous!
  • Development and learning budget, courses, activities, books, anything that helps you excel.
  • We are working on introducing more perks, depending on your location.


ü§ù Hiring process
  • Initial call with a Recruiter
  • Portfolio review
  • Brainstorming session and Design challenge
  • Get to know call with the 2 people from product team

Encouraging diversity in all its forms, Pennylane strives to offer an inclusive, caring and fulfilling work environment in our offices and remotely. We provide equal opportunities and consideration regardless of background, origin, gender, religion, sexual orientation or handicap.

results.title: Lead Game Designer - Cooperative Social Slots
results.description:
Carry1st is Africa‚Äôs leading publisher of mobile games and digital content. Operating at the intersection of games, fintech, and web3, we scale awesome content in underserved frontier markets. Carry1st has a proprietary payments and ecommerce platform which allows players to acquire global content using locally-accessible payment methods. We are backed by awesome investors like: Andreessen Horowitz, Google, Riot Games, Avenir, Konvoy Ventures, and Nas.

As Lead Game Designer you‚Äôll be responsible for defining and guiding the creation of a social (really social. Not just competitive) multiplayer game based on slots, that will be played by millions of players.

You‚Äôll work in close collaboration with our awesome Product, Creative, and Engineering teams, using your design skills, product mentality, and passion for mobile games to design the gameplay features at every stage of the process.

From contributing design documentation, through facilitating implementation and content creation, to managing game configuration ‚Äì you will be an integral part in ensuring the successful delivery of the game.

You will‚Ä¶

  • Bring your own experience and creativity to create a vision that leads the way for an awesome new game.
  • Holistically design the gameplay experience through social mechanics, content, economy, UI & UX, pacing & monetisation, features & events with player motivation.
  • Write detailed Game Design specifications and configurations. Follow up and ensure correct implementation of your designs.
  • Collaborate closely with PMs & Analysts to study player behaviours & the game‚Äôs performance, then leverage data to improve KPI‚Äôs by modifying your designs and configurations.

Requirements

What makes you a great candidate?

  • 3+ years of experience in F2P Games. RPG, Idle games or Social casino or other multiplayer social games - an advantage.
  • Able to create & design experiences that shape positive player behaviors
  • Ability to design and model the game‚Äôs economy and player progression based on your design
  • Experienced in optimizing of live games based on usage data
  • Experience leading teams to align and execute against a product vision and goals
  • Passion for games, mobile games in particular

Benefits

What will it be like to work at Carry1st?

Carry1st is a fast-growing, dynamic place to work. And while we are laser focused on building the flagship mobile internet company in Africa, our team is fully remote and 100% global - with people in 20+ countries! At Carry1st, you will‚Ä¶

  • Build awesome, industry-changing products, every day
  • Grow with a VC-backed startup at the intersection of gaming, fintech, and web3
  • Work from anywhere in the world with international teammates
  • Own shares in the Company - enabling you to benefit from the value you create

Some additional perks‚Ä¶

  • Co-working excursions: Travel to meet your colleagues in cities around the world
  • Awesome equipment: Get everything you need to work effectively
  • Remote working allowance: Put an additional $600 / year to optimise your WFH experience
  • Learning and development: Attend courses, conferences and training events
  • Social events: Participate in regular company events to relax and connect with teammates
  • Birthday leave: Enjoy a paid day off on your special day

We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it's the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger. Join us!

Learn more about Carry1st‚Ä¶

  • Andreessen Horowitz shared why they invested in Carry1st
  • Bloomberg announced that Nas and Google joined Carry1st‚Äôs $20M round
  • Quartz reported on Carry1st and the potential of the African gaming market

results.title: UI / UX Designer
results.description:
Working Location

We are a mixture of remote and hybrid working. Our primary location and only hybrid office is in London and we have remote teams across locations globally which overlap well with the GMT time zone.

Applicant requirements

  • Able to overlap with the GMT UK timezone and hours of 10am - 5pm
  • Our common company language is English and applicants must be able to communicate in this language fluently
  • Must be able to travel to London for in-person company events/workshops 2-5 times a year without a requirement of a visa or long-haul travel

What we are looking for

We are currently looking for an experienced UI/UX Designer to join our multidisciplinary design team, crafting innovative features for the future of mobile fashion games.

You will work from design concepting through to interface delivery of game features: working with game designers and PMs to outline the spec, create user flows and wireframes. You will collaborate with engineers and artists to make your experiences come to life in Unity, and ship these to millions of users. this role you can expect to be working all the way from sketches and (digital) whiteboards through to prototypes, animation and high-fidelity UI screens. Designers at Drest are T-shaped, with broad knowledge of the product design process while having something they really excel at- whether it‚Äôs qualitative research, prototyping or icon design!

We're looking for a player-centered designer who‚Äôs passionate about mobile games- bonus if you‚Äôve got experience in agile environments, the fashion industry or app development teams. We like to move fast, test things and get stuck in together to build the world's top mobile fashion game, while keeping our players at the core of what we do.

What you will do..

  • Work with game designers to translate concepts into user flows and wireframes
  • Create wireframes, interactive prototypes, and documentation to clearly convey design ideas and direction
  • Present and pitch designs to key stakeholders
  • Develop the look and feel of the UI in collaboration with the Head of UI/UX, advocating for design consistency, functionality and accessibility throughout the product
  • Work closely with engineering team to ensure proper implementation of your designs
  • Grow knowledge of industry design trends and best practices
  • Stay up to date on the fashion and lifestyle gaming market and competitors‚Äô titles.

What you will bring‚Ä¶

  • 3+ years‚Äô experience working in a design role
  • A portfolio demonstrating stylish visual and interaction design skills
  • Demonstrated ability to translate complex designs into clear wireframes and user flows
  • Experience in Figma, Sketch or similar prototyping and mockup tools
  • Love for creative collaboration and ability to take constructive criticism
  • Knowledge of UX design processes
  • Ability to present your ideas thoughtfully in both written and visual format
  • Interests in Fashion and Games is a strong plus

Bonus points if you have‚Ä¶

  • Demonstrated experience of released products as a UI/UX designer - games or lifestyle apps preferred
  • Worked on games targeted at a female audience
  • Experience working on games in which players can create content
  • Experience working as part of a development team
  • Interest in luxury design and fashion

What you will get in return

  • A competitive salary
  • Private Medical Insurance
  • Dental, Optical and Hearing cover
  • Cycle Scheme
  • Life Assurance
  • Pension Scheme
  • 25 days annual leave + Local Bank Holidays
  • Birthday Leave
  • Cross-team learning opportunities
  • Hybrid/Remote working options

More About DREST

DREST is the world‚Äôs first interactive luxury lifestyle & styling game, combining state-of-the-art technology with a luxury fashion and beauty styling experience that has real-time content at its core.

We are an award-winning fast-growth digital platform led by industry experts from the tech, luxury fashion, gaming and e-commerce worlds.

Centered around gamification, entertainment and creativity, DREST combines state-of-the-art technology with in-game fashion discovery, styling and shopping, all inspired by a real-time content feed reflecting the daily global fashion and lifestyle zeitgeist.

Our mission is to open up the fun, fantasy and creativity of the exclusive world of fashion, lifestyle and luxury to all via social gaming. By doing this, we are creating new and meaningful communications for one of the most exciting and impactful industries in the world through the application of gaming and proprietary technology and seminal art and design.

The leader in the development of luxury, lifestyle & beauty games, DREST partners with the very best of luxury brands worldwide including Gucci, Prada, Valentino, Burberry, Cartier, Breitling, Fenty, Armani, NARS and Bang & Olufsen amongst 250 others. DREST‚Äôs e-commerce partner is Farfetch, the world‚Äôs leading luxury fashion marketplace where everything one plays with is shoppable in real life. Named by Fast Company as one of ‚ÄòThe Most Innovative Gaming Companies‚Äô in the world (2021) DREST is forging ahead in this groundbreaking gaming genre.

Our employees are spread across the globe and we pride ourselves on our multiculturalism & diversity. We hire from the exciting worlds of gaming, tech, luxury fashion & lifestyle bringing a variety of perspectives closer together with the aim of creating inclusive, dynamic, equitable & original products tailored to our audiences around the world.

results.title: Mid/Senior 3D Artist(s)
results.description:

Several years later, our Seattle studio was founded and is run by another extraordinary engineer, George Davison. The studio embodies an ‚Äúopen office‚Äù collaborative process where all team members are expected to contribute to the design and the development process. The team has built a next-generation engine tentatively titled the "Unchained Engine" which is powering their two games in development - Camelot Unchained,¬†a niche RvR old-school MMORPG (currently in Beta) and Final Stand: Ragnarok, a PvE looter-slasher in which teams of any size fight against hordes of NPCs (currently in very Early Access on Steam).

¬†



Job Description

City State Entertainment is looking for an experienced 3D Artist (generalist) who has passion for creating 3D Art. Experience working across a variety of styles/purposes (such as Characters, Props, Hard Surface, Soft¬†Cloth or Environments) and some in-engine and Z-Brush (Hard surfacing) experience would be an advantage for this role.

¬†



Qualifications

What we are looking for:

‚Ä¢ Strong Maya/Max, Photoshop, Zbrush, Substance Painter skills.

‚Ä¢ Knowledge creating and optimizing assets for games
‚Ä¢ A strong communicator that is willing to seek out others when in need of and give as well in return

‚Ä¢ Able to work online, in our Fairfax, Virginia or our Seattle, Washington office. Remote work from any location also an option

¬†

¬†

¬†



Additional Information

Bonus:
‚Ä¢ Has experience creating structures/buildings for game environments

Note: City State Entertainment is hiring for a broad range of positions on a growing team. We have definite skill and task needs, but the eventual division of tasks within the team will depend on the eventual team members. If you‚Äôre an outstanding and talented individual whose qualifications fall halfway between two of our listings, we‚Äôd still like to hear from you. All candidates must have excellent written and verbal communication skills. While we prefer candidates who can work on-site at either of our Washington DC/Seattle area offices in the U.S.A. Due to COVID-19, all employees are currently working remotely for the time being. Candidates who are hired as "remote only" team members will not ever be required to relocate to either area. We are an emphatically equal-opportunity employer.¬†

results.title: Senior Independent UX/UI Designer
results.description:
A¬∑Team¬†is a VC-backed, stealth, application-only home on the internet for Senior Independent UX/UI Designers (along with developers & product managers) to team up with hand-picked, high-growth companies on their next big thing.¬†

After talking with hundreds of independent engineers, designers, and product folks, we heard over and over that finding vetted, high-quality, consistent clients is hard, and projects are often too small to be rewarding. A¬∑Team matches small teams of the most talented builders in the world with companies backed by a16z, YC, Softbank, General Catalyst, etc. on a contract basis for many of their most important initiatives. We quietly launched in May 2020, and have helped A¬∑Teamers earn $11.4+ million since.

As part of A¬∑Team, you can expect:

  • High-paying, meaningful missions with the most audacious companies¬†sent your way; generally $110-$190/hr, with vetted, fascinating clients doing work that matters. We're picky about who we partner with; new clients only come in via trusted referral. We've worked with Lyft, McGraw Hill, ClearCo, irl.com, the former CEO of Waze, the leading vaccine production software, several new unicorns we can't say here, and dozens of startups backed by a16z/YC/Softbank/etc.
  • Work alongside friends old & new:¬†our niche is small/diverse product teams, since clients with larger budgets and higher-impact work tell us they want teams, not individuals. Of course, we keep friends together whenever we can.
  • Full autonomy:¬†say "no" to things that don't excite you. The most talented builders often juggle a few things at once, so there's never pressure to join an A¬∑Team mission if you don't have the bandwidth. If we're no longer a fit, it's easy to leave or pause too.¬†
  • Small, curated, off-the-record gatherings:¬†for conversations hard to have elsewhere. Long-term, we're creating micro-communities for the world's top builders to become friends around the things they care about.
  • Keep 100% of what you earn:¬†if you charge $130/hr, you get $130/hr. A¬∑Team makes money by charging a small, flat, transparent platform fee on¬†top¬†of your rate.

How to apply:

Go here:¬†https://build.a.team/remotivedesignerreferral¬†+ mention Remotive.¬†No resume or cover letter needed; we respect your time so the application is short. We're also much more interested in seeing what you've made, and excited to chat more if there‚Äôs a fit.

What you‚Äôll do:

  • Once part of A.Team, you‚Äôll regularly be invited to impactful missions that match your interests, which you can accept or decline. Take your pick from early-stage incubations with world-class founders, to fast-growing super-funded companies, to old school non-tech incumbents looking to build as a tech giant would

  • Missions usually involve building an ambitious piece of software from 0 to 1 as part of a small 3-4 person team.¬†

  • You‚Äôll be paid to scope it out, give the client options, guide strategy, and execute on the selected solution. Sometimes the client has a clear vision, sometimes not; which is why A.Team builders tend to be senior folks who can work together to find the right direction.¬†

Who A¬∑Team is for:

  • Senior UX/UI Designers who left large companies and high-growth startups to pursue their craft with autonomy.

  • Those who prefer consistent contract work over a full-time role, who want to create a variety of new products alongside other top-tier builders.

  • The majority of A.Teamers spend most of their time doing independent work, but a sizeable percentage are either employed full-time (but testing out client work), bootstrapping a side project, or looking for their next big thing

Who A¬∑Team is¬†not¬†for:

  • People looking for small gigs

  • Folks looking to build simple wordpress/wix/squarespace-style websites

  • Those still early in their careers and recent university/bootcamp grads (at least not yet)

Our long-term vision:

A¬∑Team¬†is a new type of company for a new kind of independent software builder. We call them "unhirables": people who traditional companies couldn‚Äôt hire full-time even if they wanted to, but who want to do their most meaningful work with their favorite people in small, autonomous, distributed expert teams.¬†

To help us secure amazing missions, we raised $5 million+ (not public, yet) from NFX, Village Global, and Box Group, along with the former CEO of Upwork, the founders of Fiverr and Lemonade, Apple's Global Head of Recruiting, YC Partner Aaron Harris, Wharton's Adam Grant, and Duke's Dan Ariely.

results.title: Creative copywriter
results.description:
Selzy is an email marketing service that helps people increase sales and engage with their clients. We're on the hunt for someone who can write engaging and persuasive copy for our landing pages, emails, social media ads, banners, etc.

¬†

What you'll need to do
  • Generate copy for all marketing projects: Black Friday, webinars and any other special promotion projects. For example, for our recurring webinars you'll need to create the following types of copy: landing page, email sequence, ad copy for Facebook and Instagram, chatbot notifications, sms notifications etc.
  • Create copy for the website. For example, copy for About Us page or a new product feature.¬†
Why it's great to work with us

Selzy does more than just emails ‚Äî we are developing a whole marketing automation platform with a startup's persistence and love for our users and desire to create wow functionality.¬†

Here's why you'll love working with us:

  • You can work remotely in an international team of 80+ people (from Cyprus, Ukraine, Thailand, etc). We all work remotely and believe in teamwork, collaboration and diversity.¬†
  • You'll get to try lots of different formats. We're experimenting a lot. This means, you will produce copy for such off-the-beaten-path projects like ‚ÄúThe Big Marketing Wall of Hate‚Äù, ‚ÄúTwitter Advent Calendar‚Äù, etc. And you'll get to let your creativity run really wild for the social media ad copy ;)¬†
  • We are always ready to help and brainstorm together if something doesn't work out. We have regular brainstorm sessions, 1-2-1 meetings, and we're always up for a quick call if you need it.

You are a great fit if:
  • You have experience producing neat marketing copy in American English for landing pages, ads, newsletters, banners, etc. Your written English is excellent (close to native) and you can prove it with your portfolio.¬†
  • You produce your copy with the business needs in mind: you know by experience which tricks to use to make that copy generate as many clicks/sign-ups/comments as it can.
  • You're ready to own up to the result of your work. We're here to help you out any moment but we expect you to take full responsibility for the copy you create.¬†
  • You're ready to dig deep to find the right info for your copy for any project. It often takes setting up calls and asking lots of questions to the project owner before you can get to writing.
  • You're a true marketing junkie. You're probably subscribed to dozens of newsletters, enjoy quirky creative ads you come across on Facebook, and have seen a gazillion landing pages so you can tell a good one from a boring one.

results.title: Sr. UX Designer
results.description:
What Makes Us Movista:

We are a team of retail veterans, innovators, and problem solvers ‚Äì and we live to create brilliant solutions to complex business problems.

Ask any employee ‚Äì Movista's culture is a large part of who we are. It's in our DNA to appreciate each other, exceed expectations in our roles, improve the lives of the people we serve, and then, after a long day, grab a beer from the office kegerator. Enjoying our work and those we work alongside is what makes us Movista.

Our company headquarters are located in the heart of Bentonville, Arkansas, across the street from a museum and greenspace, just a 2-minute bike ride from all that the downtown art and market districts have to offer.¬†

Job Summary:

The Sr. UX Designer role will be part of Movista's Product Design team, responsible for providing innovative design solutions across multiple products.

Working alongside product managers, designers, and engineering teams, you will play a key role in the successful delivery of solutions to our clients. As the Sr. UX Designer, you will have huge impact on defining how our users will utilize our products and ensure that our design solutions are translated through innovative and intuitive design patterns.¬†Our solutions support distributed workforces in retail environments that experience high turnover via mobile applications.¬† This makes usability design essential to ensure our clients have tools that can get their teams productive quickly.¬†

You will be an experienced member in a growing team responsible for articulating a design vision and execution through an iterative, evidence-driven design process. You will also ensure that you're constantly thinking about the end user and making data driven design decisions and effectively communicating these decisions to the broader team. You will foster cross-functional collaboration by working closely with product managers, engineers, and client teams to shape the vision for our products.

Responsibilities:

  • Be a leader in design for new experiences and improvements of existing experiences while planning and defining strategy for the direction of future iterations.
  • Focus designs on intuitive usability for a high-turnover, remote workforce in a way that facilitates remote team productivity with little to no training.
  • Plan and propose innovative solutions for a wide variety of product design challenges including, but not limited to: mobile, tablet and desktop.
  • Be able to quickly iterate on design solutions based on user and team feedback with a positive open-minded approach.
  • Consistently back decisions with insights, data and testing all while being able to articulate why you made those design decisions.
  • Work collaboratively with engineers and product managers throughout all stages of the product lifecycle.
  • Be a key member of the team responsible for maintaining design systems for web and mobile experiences
  • Assist in leading the process for usability testing for remote and in person users and bring UX research practices and innovation to the table across all products.
  • Provide design solutions to meet cost-effectiveness and on-time deliveries.
  • Validate product designs, identify constraints and provide corrective actions.
  • Assist in making process improvements to ensure product quality and productivity.
  • Interact cross-functionally to clearly understand customers' product requirements and vision.
